CWE-362 race_conditions.name: CWE-362 race_conditions
CWE-362 race_conditions.description: The program contains a code sequence that can run concurrently with other code, and the code sequence requires temporary, exclusive access to a shared resource, but a timing window exists in which the shared resource can be modified by another code sequence that is operating concurrently.

Race_condition_smells.name: Race_condition_smells
Race_condition_smells.description: Code smells related to possible race conditions

CWE-362/CWE-367!.name: CWE-362/CWE-367!
CWE-362/CWE-367!.description: This programs opens a file in a way that an attacker could take advantage of the race condition.

CWE-362.name: CWE-362
CWE-362.description: The program contains a code sequence that can run concurrently with other code, and the code sequence requires temporary, exclusive access to a shared resource, but a timing window exists in which the shared resource can be modified by another code sequence that is operating concurrently.

CWE-362, CWE-20.name: CWE-362, CWE-20
CWE-362, CWE-20.description: Accepting input for filenames leaves the code open to race conditions and buffer overflows.

CWE-20 Improper_input_validation.name: CWE-20 Improper_input_validation
CWE-20 Improper_input_validation.description: The product receives input or data, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the input has the properties that are required to process the data safely and correctly.

CWE-119 Improper_restriction_of_operatio.name: CWE-119 Improper_restriction_of_operations_in_memory
CWE-119 Improper_restriction_of_operatio.description: The software performs operations on a memory buffer, but it can read from or write to a memory location that is outside of the intended boundary of the buffer.

Memory_use_smells.name: Memory_use_smells
Memory_use_smells.description: Code smells related to the use of memory

CWE-125.name: CWE-125
CWE-125.description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer.

CWE-785.name: CWE-785
CWE-785.description: The software invokes a function for normalizing paths or file names, but it provides an output buffer that is smaller than the maximum possible size, such as PATH_MAX.

CWE-126.name: CWE-126
CWE-126.description: The software reads from a buffer using buffer access mechanisms such as indexes or pointers that reference memory locations after the targeted buffer.

CWE-788.name: CWE-788
CWE-788.description: The software reads or writes to a buffer using an index or pointer that references a memory location after the end of the buffer.

CWE-120, CWE-20.name: CWE-120, CWE-20
CWE-120, CWE-20.description: Does not limit input, may be vulnerable to buffer overflows.

CWE-119!/CWE-120.name: CWE-119!/CWE-120
CWE-119!/CWE-120.description: This statically-sized array can be improperly restricted, leading to potential overflows.

CWE-120.name: CWE-120
CWE-120.description: The program copies an input buffer to an output buffer without verifying that the size of the input buffer is less than the size of the output buffer, leading to a buffer overflow.

CWE-120/CWE-785!.name: CWE-120/CWE-785!
CWE-120/CWE-785!.description: This function does not protect against buffer overflows, and may even overflow internally.

CWE-362, CWE-20.name: CWE-362, CWE-20
CWE-362, CWE-20.description: Accepting input for filenames leaves the code open to race conditions and buffer overflows.

CWE-676, CWE-120.name: CWE-676, CWE-120
CWE-676, CWE-120.description: This program uses a dangerous function "getpw" that may overflow the provided buffer.

CWE-190 Integer_wraparound.name: CWE-190 Integer_wraparound
CWE-190 Integer_wraparound.description: The software performs a calculation that can produce an integer overflow or wraparound, when the logic assumes that the resulting value will always be larger than the original value.

Integer_overflow_smells.description: Code smells related to data data encryption

CWE-20 Improper_input_validation.description: The product receives input or data, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the input has the properties that are required to process the data safely and correctly.

CWE-119 Improper_restriction_of_operatio.name: CWE-119 Improper_restriction_of_operations_in_memory
CWE-119 Improper_restriction_of_operatio.description: The software performs operations on a memory buffer, but it can read from or write to a memory location that is outside of the intended boundary of the buffer.

Memory_use_smells.name: Memory_use_smells
Memory_use_smells.description: Code smells related to the use of memory

CWE-125.name: CWE-125
CWE-125.description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer.

CWE-785.name: CWE-785
CWE-785.description: The software invokes a function for normalizing paths or file names, but it provides an output buffer that is smaller than the maximum possible size, such as PATH_MAX.

CWE-126.name: CWE-126
CWE-126.description: The software reads from a buffer using buffer access mechanisms such as indexes or pointers that reference memory locations after the targeted buffer.

CWE-788.name: CWE-788
CWE-788.description: The software reads or writes to a buffer using an index or pointer that references a memory location after the end of the buffer.

CWE-120, CWE-20.name: CWE-120, CWE-20
CWE-120, CWE-20.description: Does not limit input, may be vulnerable to buffer overflows.

CWE-119!/CWE-120.name: CWE-119!/CWE-120
CWE-119!/CWE-120.description: This statically-sized array can be improperly restricted, leading to potential overflows.

CWE-120.name: CWE-120
CWE-120.description: The program copies an input buffer to an output buffer without verifying that the size of the input buffer is less than the size of the output buffer, leading to a buffer overflow.

CWE-120/CWE-785!.name: CWE-120/CWE-785!
CWE-120/CWE-785!.description: This function does not protect against buffer overflows, and may even overflow internally.

CWE-362, CWE-20.name: CWE-362, CWE-20
CWE-362, CWE-20.description: Accepting input for filenames leaves the code open to race conditions and buffer overflows.

CWE-676, CWE-120.name: CWE-676, CWE-120
CWE-676, CWE-120.description: This program uses a dangerous function "getpw" that may overflow the provided buffer.

CWE-190 Integer_wraparound.name: CWE-190 Integer_wraparound
CWE-190 Integer_wraparound.description: The software performs a calculation that can produce an integer overflow or wraparound, when the logic assumes that the resulting value will always be larger than the original value.

Integer_overflow_smells.name: Integer_overflow_smells
Integer_overflow_smells.description: Code smells related to data data encryption

CWE-77 OS_command_injection.name: CWE-77 OS_command_injection
CWE-77 OS_command_injection.description: The software constructs all or part of a command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended command when it is sent to a downstream component.

OS_command_injection_smells.name: OS_command_injection_smells
OS_command_injection_smells.description: Code smells related to OS command injection

CWE-676, CWE-120.description: This program uses a dangerous function "getpw" that may overflow the provided buffer.

Vendor Security Quality.name: Vendor Security Quality
Vendor Security Quality.description: The total security quality value representing the entire system

Authenticity.name: Authenticity
Authenticity.description: The property that data originated from its purported source.

CWE-269 Improper_privilege_management.name: CWE-269 Improper_privilege_management
CWE-269 Improper_privilege_management.description: The software does not properly assign, modify, track, or check privileges for an actor, creating an unintended sphere of control for that actor.

Privilege_management_smells.name: Privilege_management_smells
Privilege_management_smells.description: Code smells related to privilege management

CWE-250, CWE-22.name: CWE-250, CWE-22
CWE-250, CWE-22.description: chroot is difficult to use correctly, make sure the program immediately chdir("/"), closes file descriptors.

CWE-250.name: CWE-250
CWE-250.description: The software performs an operation at a privilege level that is higher than the minimum level required.

CWE-668 Exposure_of_resource_to_wrong_sp.name: CWE-668 Exposure_of_resource_to_wrong_sphere
CWE-668 Exposure_of_resource_to_wrong_sp.description: The product exposes a resource to the wrong control sphere, providing unintended actors with inappropriate access to the resource.

Exposure_to_wrong_sphere_smells.name: Exposure_to_wrong_sphere_smells
Exposure_to_wrong_sphere_smells.description: Code smells related to the control sphere of resources

CWE-732.name: CWE-732
CWE-732.description: The product specifies permissions for a security-critical resource in a way that allows that resource to be read or modified by unintended actors.

CWE-22.name: CWE-22
CWE-22.description: The software uses external input to construct a pathname that is intended to identify a file or directory that is located underneath a restricted parent directory, but the software does not properly neutralize special elements within the pathname that can cause the pathname to resolve to a location that is outside the restricted directory.

CWE-250, CWE-22.name: CWE-250, CWE-22
CWE-250, CWE-22.description: chroot is difficult to use correctly, make sure the program immediately chdir("/"), closes file descriptors.

CWE-134.name: CWE-134
CWE-134.description: The software uses a function that accepts a format string as an argument, but the format string originates from an external source.

CWE-377.name: CWE-377
CWE-377.description: Creating and using insecure temporary files can leave application and system data vulnerable to attack.

CWE-669 Incorrect_resource_transfer_betw.name: CWE-669 Incorrect_resource_transfer_between_spheres
CWE-669 Incorrect_resource_transfer_betw.description: The product does not properly transfer a resource/behavior to another spere, or improperly imports a resource/behavior from another sphere, in a manner that provides unintended control over that resource.

Incorrect_resource_transfer_smells.name: Incorrect_resource_transfer_smells
Incorrect_resource_transfer_smells.description: Code smells related to the transfer of control of resources

CWE-829.name: CWE-829
CWE-829.description: The software imports, requires or includes executable functionality (such as a library) from a source that is outside of the intended control sphere.

CWE-829, CWE-20.name: CWE-829, CWE-20
CWE-829, CWE-20.description: Ensure that the full path to the library is specified, or current directory may be used

CWE-710 Improper_adherence_to_coding_sta.name: CWE-710 Improper_adherence_to_coding_standards
CWE-710 Improper_adherence_to_coding_sta.description: The software does not follow certain coding rules for development, which can lead to weaknesses.

CWE-1177 Use_of_prohibited_code.name: CWE-1177 Use_of_prohibited_code
CWE-1177 Use_of_prohibited_code.description: The software uses a function, library, or third party component that has been explicitly prohibited, whether by the developer or the customer.

Coding_standards_smells.name: Coding_standards_smells
Coding_standards_smells.description: Code smells related to adherence to coding rules

CWE-785.name: CWE-785
CWE-785.description: The software invokes a function for normalizing paths or file names, but it provides an output buffer that is smaller than the maximum possible size, such as PATH_MAX.

CWE-676.name: CWE-676
CWE-676.description: The program invokes a potentially dangerous function that could introduce a vulnerability if it is used incorrectly, but the function can also be used safely.

CWE-120/CWE-785!.name: CWE-120/CWE-785!
CWE-120/CWE-785!.description: This function does not protect against buffer overflows, and may even overflow internally.

CWE-676, CWE-120.name: CWE-676, CWE-120
CWE-676, CWE-120.description: This program uses a dangerous function "getpw" that may overflow the provided buffer.

CWE-691 Insufficient_control_flow_manage.name: CWE-691 Insufficient_control_flow_management
CWE-691 Insufficient_control_flow_manage.description: The code does not sufficiently manage its control flow during execution, creating conditions in which the control flow can be modified in unexpected ways.

CWE-362 race_conditions.name: CWE-362 race_conditions
CWE-362 race_conditions.description: The program contains a code sequence that can run concurrently with other code, and the code sequence requires temporary, exclusive access to a shared resource, but a timing window exists in which the shared resource can be modified by another code sequence that is operating concurrently.

Race_condition_smells.name: Race_condition_smells
Race_condition_smells.description: Code smells related to possible race conditions

CWE-362/CWE-367!.name: CWE-362/CWE-367!
CWE-362/CWE-367!.description: This programs opens a file in a way that an attacker could take advantage of the race condition.

CWE-362.name: CWE-362
CWE-362.description: The program contains a code sequence that can run concurrently with other code, and the code sequence requires temporary, exclusive access to a shared resource, but a timing window exists in which the shared resource can be modified by another code sequence that is operating concurrently.

CWE-362, CWE-20.name: CWE-362, CWE-20
CWE-362, CWE-20.description: Accepting input for filenames leaves the code open to race conditions and buffer overflows.

Confidentiality.name: Confidentiality
Confidentiality.description: Preserving authorized restrictions on information access and disclosure, including means for protecting personal privacy and proprietary information.

Encrypt_data.name: Encrypt_data
Encrypt_data.description: Weaknesses in this category are related to the design and architecture of data confidentiality in a system. Frequently these deal with the use of encryption libraries.

Encryption_smells.name: Encryption_smells
Encryption_smells.description: Code smells related to data data encryption

CWE-327.name: CWE-327
CWE-327.description: Use of broken or risky cryptographic algorithm

Cross_cutting.name: Cross_cutting
Cross_cutting.description: Weaknesses in this category are related to the design and architecture of multiple security tactics and how they affect a system. A weakness in this category could lead to a degradation in the quality of many capabilities.

CWE-807 Reliance_on_untrusted_inputs.name: CWE-807 Reliance_on_untrusted_inputs
CWE-807 Reliance_on_untrusted_inputs.description: The application uses a security mechanism that relies on the existence or values of an input, but the input can be modified by an untrusted actor in a way that bypasses the protection mechanism.

Cross_cutting_smells.name: Cross_cutting_smells
Cross_cutting_smells.description: Code smells related to design and architecture of security tactics

CWE-807, CWE-20.name: CWE-807, CWE-20
CWE-807, CWE-20.description: This use of environment variables can be vulnerable, since an attacker can change them.

CWE-807.name: CWE-807
CWE-807.description: The application uses a security mechanism that relies on the existence or values of an input, but the input can be modified by an untrusted actor in a way that bypasses the protection mechanism.

Limit_exposure.name: Limit_exposure
Limit_exposure.description: Weaknesses in this category are related to the design and architecture of the entry points to a system. Frequently these deal with minimizing the attack surface through designing the system with the least needed amount of entry points.

CWE-829 Inclusion_of_functionality_from_.name: CWE-829 Inclusion_of_functionality_from_untrusted_control_sphere
CWE-829 Inclusion_of_functionality_from_.description: The software imports, requires or includes executable functionality (such as a library) from a source that is outside of the intended control sphere.

Limit_exposure_smells.name: Limit_exposure_smells
Limit_exposure_smells.description: Code smells related to surface of attack

CWE-829, CWE-20.name: CWE-829, CWE-20
CWE-829, CWE-20.description: Ensure that the full path to the library is specified, or current directory may be used

Integrity.name: Integrity
Integrity.description: Guarding against improper information modification or destruction, and includes ensuring information non-repudiation and authenticity.

CWE-20 Improper_input_validation.description: The product receives input or data, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the input has the properties that are required to process the data safely and correctly.

Integer_overflow_smells.description: Code smells related to data data encryption

CWE-190.name: CWE-190
CWE-190.description: The software performs a calculation that can produce an integer overflow or wraparound, when the logic assumes that the resulting value will always be larger than the original value.

Memory_use_smells.name: Memory_use_smells
Memory_use_smells.description: Code smells related to the use of memory

CWE-125.name: CWE-125
CWE-125.description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer.

CWE-785.name: CWE-785
CWE-785.description: The software invokes a function for normalizing paths or file names, but it provides an output buffer that is smaller than the maximum possible size, such as PATH_MAX.

CWE-126.name: CWE-126
CWE-126.description: The software reads from a buffer using buffer access mechanisms such as indexes or pointers that reference memory locations after the targeted buffer.

CWE-788.name: CWE-788
CWE-788.description: The software reads or writes to a buffer using an index or pointer that references a memory location after the end of the buffer.

CWE-120, CWE-20.description: Does not limit input, may be vulnerable to buffer overflows.

CWE-119!/CWE-120.description: This statically-sized array can be improperly restricted, leading to potential overflows.

CWE-120.description: The program copies an input buffer to an output buffer without verifying that the size of the input buffer is less than the size of the output buffer, leading to a buffer overflow.

CWE-120/CWE-785!.description: This function does not protect against buffer overflows, and may even overflow internally.

Exposure_to_wrong_sphere_smells.name: Exposure_to_wrong_sphere_smells
Exposure_to_wrong_sphere_smells.description: Code smells related to the control sphere of resources

CWE-732.name: CWE-732
CWE-732.description: The product specifies permissions for a security-critical resource in a way that allows that resource to be read or modified by unintended actors.

CWE-22.name: CWE-22
CWE-22.description: The software uses external input to construct a pathname that is intended to identify a file or directory that is located underneath a restricted parent directory, but the software does not properly neutralize special elements within the pathname that can cause the pathname to resolve to a location that is outside the restricted directory.

CWE-250, CWE-22.name: CWE-250, CWE-22
CWE-250, CWE-22.description: chroot is difficult to use correctly, make sure the program immediately chdir("/"), closes file descriptors.

CWE-134.name: CWE-134
CWE-134.description: The software uses a function that accepts a format string as an argument, but the format string originates from an external source.

CWE-377.name: CWE-377
CWE-377.description: Creating and using insecure temporary files can leave application and system data vulnerable to attack.

Cross_cutting_smells.name: Cross_cutting_smells
Cross_cutting_smells.description: Code smells related to design and architecture of security tactics

CWE-807, CWE-20.description: This use of environment variables can be vulnerable, since an attacker can change them.

CWE-807.name: CWE-807
CWE-807.description: The application uses a security mechanism that relies on the existence or values of an input, but the input can be modified by an untrusted actor in a way that bypasses the protection mechanism.

Limit_exposure_smells.description: Code smells related to surface of attack

CWE-829.name: CWE-829
CWE-829.description: The software imports, requires or includes executable functionality (such as a library) from a source that is outside of the intended control sphere.

CWE-829, CWE-20.description: Ensure that the full path to the library is specified, or current directory may be used
